properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for more thunderstorm development early this evening. While the risk of severe thunderstorms has diminished significantly there is a chance of thunderstorm redevelopment. Should thunderstorms develop they may be accompanied by wind gusts near 90 km/h. Any thunderstorm development will weaken through the evening. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-20T04:59:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-19T21:29:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1052446755.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:33 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-20T02:24:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-19T23:33:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1995906035.2020
Area: Joutel - Matagami area

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Isolated severe thunderstorms may develop early this evening. Main threats are damaging wind gusts near 90 km/h and hail. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: This evening, conditions will be favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor visibilities due to thunderstorms at times heavy. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:

Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Isolated severe thunderstorms are likely this evening. Damaging hail near 3 centimetres in diameter and heavy downpours may be associated with thunderstorms. There is also a risk of a tornado. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from Moose Factory to 50 km northwest of Kapuskasing, moving east at 70 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-20T02:39:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-19T23:26:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0395788732.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Some strong thunderstorms are developing over southern Alberta. These storms are capable of producing 2 cm hail, gusty winds to 90 km/h, and locally heavy downpours. These storms will dissipate later this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-20T07:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-19T22:00:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1214650012.2020

Damaging hail near 3 centimetres in diameter and heavy downpours may be associated with thunderstorms. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-20T02:59:12-00:00

Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:20 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A strong thunderstorm is located 40 km southwest of Brooks. This storm is moving to the south at 40 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-20T04:19:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-20T01:21:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3195993886.2020
Area: M.D. of Taber near Enchant, M.D. of Taber near Vauxhall and Hays, M.D. of Taber near Taber and Barnwell

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing large hail and heavy rain. Strong thunderstorms are expected to the west of Great Slave Lake. These storms can produce 2 cm or larger hail and locally heavy downpours. These storms are expected to dissipate later this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-20T08:04:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-19T21:30:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0739537307.2020
Area: Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake, Hay River Region including Enterprise
